content:
Let me give you more context. When I use pyLDAvis, here are the top words that are likely to be represented in each topic: 

Topic 0: 

anxiety
time
deadlines
doubt
eventual
capital
procrastination.
deep-seated
preemptive
elicited
exceeds
withholding
linguistic
nonnegotiable
necessity
publication.
reduce
writing:
researchers
anxiety’
‘academic
workshop
#phd
#doctoral
#wellbeing
looking
forward
process
run
online

For topic 0, here are some sample tweets: 

A new International university client—I will run my Online ‘Academic Writing: Reduce Anxiety’ workshop for PhDs from @nuigalway tomorrow. I come from the west of Ireland so I am really looking forward to it 🙂. #wellbeing #phd #doctoral https://t.co/4WlQ0bGLmF
42 I’ll run international and UK #online #PhD ‘Academic Writing: Reduce Anxiety’ workshops for The @univgroningen and @cardiffmet @CardiffMetDA next week. 🙂👍 #phd #doctoral #thesis #academicwriting @LIDo\_DTP @SensorCDT @NOWNANO\_CDT @GW4plusDTP @NLD\_BBSRCDTP @aims\_oxford @it\_se https://t.co/YtcO6jxHYO
3023 It’s not academic writing procrastination. It’s a preemptive withholding of linguistic capital until such time as anxiety elicited by nonnegotiable deadlines exceeds deep-seated doubt as to the necessity of the eventual publication.
200 fucking anxiety-treating exposition therapy by writing emails to important academic figures
269 Really enjoyed delivering my ‘Academic Writing: Reduce Anxiety’ workshop for #PhDs from @cardiffmet this morning. 👍🙂 #phd #doctoral https://t.co/SUx7pt0YDg
Name: text, dtype: object

Here are tweets: 

----- Most Probable Topic: 1 -----
988 I'm writing research code very differently than I used to in grad school - from anxiety-inducing brittle academic code to test-driven development. Would others be interested in learning how to write research code that won't bite back?
3478 icymi: self-care and well-being efforts in academia are often mischaracterized as procrastination due to the ill-defined nature of academic work and success resulting in persistent negative affect (anxiety, guilt) and work-life imbalance\n\ntl;dr: I should be writing
1001 I'm writing research code very differently than I used to in grad school - from anxiety-inducing brittle academic code to test-driven development. Would others be interested in learning how to write research code that won't bite back?
3808 icymi: self-care and well-being efforts in academia are often mischaracterized as procrastination due to the ill-defined nature of academic work and success resulting in persistent negative affect (anxiety, guilt) and work-life imbalance\n\ntl;dr: I should be writing

Tweets: 
4659 Confronting the Anxiety of Academic Writing | Tuesday, December 10, 1-2 p.m. ET | http://t.co/fCaXXb7UVW #academic #writing
4068 Testimonial snippet: "Academic Writing Club has provided me with foundations for reducing anxiety around writing..."
799 This morning, I was joined by colleagues in writing to @SecCardona, urging him to provide all 50 states with standardized testing waivers for this academic year.\n\nThis has been a traumatic year for our students. We must focus on formative assessment, not anxiety-inducing testing. https://t.co/pTVUpxvi5F
1951 @random\_walker @Princeton @usnews I highly recommend Engines of Anxiety: Academic Rankings, Reputation & Accountability by Sauder & Espeland. The system creates perverse incentives. I'm writing up some case studies now, but see my paper on Edu Purpose Limitations for a preview https://t.co/NPdMJY4r5Y
1658 You know you're a nerd when you read about a style of academic writing that employs a four-paragraph essay scheme with highly structured paragraphs, and the reading alone gives you an anxiety attack.\n\nWay too structured.
Name: text, dtype: object
